questions.question_text: Some ASIs have coloured arcs and lines marked on their dials. A yellow arc and a white arc indicate:
options: A. cautionary range and normal operating range.
B. flap operating speed range and normal operating range.
C. cautionary range and flap operating speed range.
D. flap operating speed range and cautionary range.

questions.question_text: What are the upper and lower limits of the yellow arc on an ASI?
options: A. lower limit VLO and upper limit VNE
B. lower limit VLE and upper limit VNE
C. lower limit VNO and upper limit VNE
D. lower limit VLO and upper limit VLE

questions.question_text: What is the symbol for an FIR boundary?
options: A. [Symbol]
B. [Symbol]
D. [Symbol]

questions.question_text: What is the local mean time, position 65°25'N 123°45'W at 2200 UTC?
Which of the following statements about the scalloping (path deflection) of VOR radials, in relation to the accuracy of navigation using a VOR/DME RNAV system is correct?
options: A. Scalloping has a negative effect on the accuracy of navigation.
B. Scalloping has a positive effect on the accuracy of navigation.
C. Scalloping has no effect on the accuracy of navigation because the accuracy is independent of VOR or DME measurements.
D. Scalloping has no effect on the accuracy of navigation because it only results in the movement of the needle of the Course Deviation Indicator.

questions.question_text: One of the possible disturbances of the ILS signals is "scalloping". Which statement is correct?
options: A. Scalloping are minor changes or bends, which can be followed by the aircraft.
B. Scalloping are minor changes or bends, which cannot be followed by the aircraft.
C. Scalloping are rapid changes or bends, which can be followed by the aircraft.
D. Scalloping causes rapid indicator changes from side to side of the intended approach path, which cannot be followed by the aircraft.

questions.question_text: You have flight plan IFR from A to B. In the flight plan it is noted that you will deviate from ATS route passing FIR boundary to B. The airway clearance reads "Cleared to B via flight planned route". Which of the following statement is correct?
options: A. The route according to the flight is accepted
B. You will get separate clearance for the deviation
C. It is not allowed to file such a flight plan.

questions.question_text: A high cockpit aircraft on a VASI app sees red, white and white
options: A. On glide slope
B. Slightly high
C. High

questions.question_text: An aircraft with 180 minutes approval for ETOPS, must be:
options: A. no more than 180 minutes from a suitable alternate, in still air, at the one engine inoperative TAS.
B. no more than 180 minutes from a suitable alternate, in still air, at the all engine TAS.
C. no more than 90 minutes from a suitable alternate, and 90 minutes from departure, at the one engine inoperative TAS
D. no more than 180 minutes from a suitable alternate, at the one engine inoperative TGS.

questions.question_text: ETOPS flight is a twin engine jet aeroplane flight conducted over a route, where no suitable airport is within an area of:
options: A. 75 minutes flying time at the approved one engine out cruise speed
B. 60 minutes flying time in still air at the approved one engine out cruise speed.
C. 60 minutes flying time in still air at the normal cruising speed.
D. 30 minutes flying time at the normal cruising speed.

questions.question_text: An aeroplane operating under the 180 minutes ETOPS rule may be up to:
options: A. 180 minutes flying time to a suitable airport in still air with one engine inoperative.
B. 180 minutes flying time to a suitable airport under the prevailing weather condition with one engine inoperative.
C. 180 minutes flying time from suitable airport in still air at a normal cruising speed.
D. 90 minutes flying time from the first en-route airport and another 90 minutes from the second en-route airport in still air with one engine inoperative

questions.question_text: EDTO is applicable to:
options: A. Twin engine operations
B. Aeroplane with two or more turbine engines
C. Aeroplane with more than two reciprocating engines

questions.question_text: EDTO stands for:
options: A. Extended Diversion Time Operations (EDTO)
B. Expected Diversion Time Overhead (EDTO)
C. Expected Direction of Take Off (EDTO)

questions.question_text: ETOPS:
options: A. CHECK ANSWER

questions.question_text: Contours are lines drawn on a map or chart joining
options: A. Places of equal elevation
B. Equal pressure
C. Equal variation.

questions.question_text: A VSI indicates increasing ROD by?
options: A. VSI needle moving downwards
B. VSI needle moving upwards
C. VSI needle stationary

questions.question_text: For the landing configuration a radio altimeter indicates?
options: A. Altitude of the main wheel above ground?
B. Height of the flight deck above the ground.
C. Height of the main wheel above the ground.

questions.question_text: The response rate of a VSI can be improved by fitting a?
options: A. Accelerometer system.
B. Choke system.
C. Bi-metalic compensator.

questions.question_text: The operating frequency range of a altitude radio altimeter is?
options: A. 2700 MHz to 2900 MHz.
B. 5 GHz
C. 4200 MHz to 4400 MHz.

questions.question_text: Radio altimeter gives height indications by:
options: A. Measuring the Doppler frequency shift in transmitted frequency
B. Measuring time diff. of a CW transmitted at fixed frequency
C. Measuring time diff. of a CW transmitted at changing frequency

questions.question_text: Low altitude radio altimeters operate on the wavelength?
options: A. Metric
B. Decimetric
C. Centimetric

questions.question_text: A radio altimeter measures?
options: A. True Altitude
B. Pressure Altitude
C. Height above the ground or water over which the aircraft is flying

questions.question_text: The failure of the radio altimeter would cause?
options: A. Loss of pressure altitude data
B. Loss of density altitude data
C. Loss of height data

questions.question_text: A radio altimeter has a maximum effective height because?
options: A. At greater heights the signal will be too weak
B. At greater heights from different modulation cycles will overlap
C. At greater heights the signal will be absorbed by moisture in the air

questions.question_text: Radio altimeters are accurate only within the height range?
options: A. Zero to 50 ft
B. Zero to 500 ft
C. Zero to 2500 ft

questions.question_text: The TO/FROM indicator of a VOR:
options: A. Tells whether a track equal to the selected bearing will bring you to or away from the VOR.
B. Tells whether you are now flying towards or from the VOR.
C. Tells whether you should turn the aircraft towards or away from the CDI indication.

questions.question_text: Dlong and Dlat 2 QUESTIONS.
options: A. SOLVE SUCH QUESTIONS

questions.question_text: MASS AND BALANCE 4-5 QUESTIONS
options: A. SOLVE QUESTIONS

questions.question_text: CDMVT - 2/3 que
options: A. SOLVE SUCH QUESTIONS

questions.question_text: Qnh pressure altitude calculation 5 QUESTIONS
options: A. SOLVE SUCH QUESTIONS

questions.question_text: 5 QUESTIONS FROM SAMPLE PAPERS FROM RK BALI NAV
options: A. SOLVE

questions.question_text: Tas mac calculation -2 ques
options: A. SOLVE CAS TAS MAC QUESTION

questions.question_text: Flightplan 3/4 queSTIONS
options: A. SOLVE FROM QUESTION BANK ON THE WEBSITE

questions.question_text: ONE QUESTION FROM SSR THEORY
options: A. SOLVE FROM THE WEBSITE QUESTION BANK

questions.question_text: 5 QUESTIONS FROM CP/PNR
options: A. SOLVE FROM THE WEBSITE QUESTION BANK

questions.question_text: GYRO THEORY 4 QUESTIONS
options: A. SOLVE FROM THE WEBSITE QUESTION BANK

questions.question_text: 1 QUESTION FROM SCALE
options: A. SOLVE FROM THE WEBSITE

questions.question_text: FEW QUESTION ASKED ABOUT THE FREQUNCY OF NAV AIDS
options: A. CHECK ANSWER
